organization.$: Jiangsu University of Science and Technology
College of Electrical and Information Engineering

head.citation-title: Nonlinear filtering approaches based pose, motion and variable focal length estimation in monocular active vision
head.abstracts: The state vector includes three dimensional (3D) translation, 3D rotation represented by quaternion, linear velocity, rotational velocity and variable focal length. 3D object line features, which are represented as dual vectors, are projected to two dimensional (2D) line features in the image plane using dual quaternion transformation, then we constitute measurement equation according to these projected 2D line features. This work studies the relative 3D pose, motion and variable focal length estimation problem in monocular active vision based on the extended Kalman filter (EKF), Unscented Kalman filter (UKF) and Gaussian particle filter (GPF). Experimental results show that only GPF can obtain convergent 3D pose, motion and variable focal length estimation results with the dynamic model proposed in this paper. Â© 2011 ISSN 1881-803X.
